citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
***The male Dachshund "Esau" (chip number****54053), and the male Dachshund "Israel" (chip number ****52076), have
moderate to severe tartar primarily on their canines. Esau was examined in March and a follow-up examination has not
been scheduled. As Esau's condition has progressed, he is now in need of a full dental. There is no record indicating
Israel received a dental examine recently. Israel shall be examined by the veterinarian and provided a dental cleaning.
Correct by May 31, 2023.

***While waiting for the licensee to arrive on property USDA observed a cream colored long haired Dachshund, later
identified as Hannah, clinging to the very top of the gate to her outdoor run about to do over the gate. Discussions with
the licensee indicate Hannah has a history of escaping from her enclosures. An enclosure must be provided for Hannah
that will keep her secured within thereby protecting her from possible injury and loss. Correct by May 24, 2023.

***The indoor and outdoor runs have coated wire gates. Approximately 15 percent of the gates observed have an excess
build up of rust, two of the gates have corrosion along the bottom edge. There are two crates in the buildings that are
coated with rust. The powdery rust rubs off on your hands when touching the crates. The accumulation of rust inhibits
effective cleaning and sanitation and depending on the severity may decrease structural strength. The gates and crates
shall be repaired or replaced to allow effective cleaning and sanitation, minimize possible disease hazard, and ensure the
enclosures are structurally sound. Correct by June 17, 2023.

***There are three sheets of wood located over the front end of three of the dog enclosures. The wood covers the top of
approximately 1/3 of the front of the enclosure. The wood was placed there to temporarily hold supplies while in use as
well as support the dogs when handled above their enclosure. The dogs have contact with the boards when jumping or
placed on them. These boards are not impervious to moisture and cannot be properly cleaned and sanitized increasing
the risk of disease hazard. All walls, boxes, houses, dens, and other surfaces in contact with the animals must be
impervious to moisture to allow effective cleaning and sanitization thereby decreasing the risk of possible disease
hazards. Correct by May 24, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
***The male Dachshund "Esau" (chip number****54053), and the male Dachshund "Israel" (chip number ****52076), have 
moderate to severe tartar primarily on their canines.  Esau was examined in March and a follow-up examination has not 
been scheduled. As Esau's condition has progressed, he is now in need of a full dental.  There is no record indicating 
Israel received a dental examine recently.  Israel shall be examined by the veterinarian and provided a dental cleaning.   
Correct by May 31, 2023. 
3.1(a) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
***While waiting for the licensee to arrive on property USDA observed a cream colored long haired Dachshund, later 
identified as Hannah, clinging to the very top of the gate to her outdoor run about to do over the gate.  Discussions with 
the licensee indicate Hannah has a history of escaping from her enclosures.  An enclosure must be provided for   Hannah 
that will keep her secured within thereby protecting her from possible injury and loss.  Correct by May 24, 2023. 
3.1(c)(1)(i) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
***The indoor and outdoor runs have coated wire gates.  Approximately 15 percent of the gates observed have an excess 
build up of rust, two of the gates have corrosion along the bottom edge.  There are two crates in the buildings that are

coated with rust.  The powdery rust rubs off on your hands when touching the crates.  The accumulation of rust inhibits 
effective cleaning and sanitation and depending on the severity may decrease structural strength.  The gates and crates 
shall be repaired or replaced to allow effective cleaning and sanitation, minimize possible disease hazard, and ensure the 
enclosures are structurally sound.  Correct by June 17, 2023. 
3.3(e)(1)(iii) 
   
Sheltered housing facilities. 
***There are three sheets of wood located over the front end of three of the dog enclosures.  The wood covers the top of 
approximately 1/3 of the front of the enclosure.  The wood was placed there to temporarily hold supplies while in use as 
well as support the dogs when handled above their enclosure.  The dogs have contact with the boards when jumping or 
placed on them. These boards are not impervious to moisture and cannot be properly cleaned and sanitized increasing 
the risk of disease hazard.  All walls, boxes, houses, dens, and other surfaces in contact with the animals must be 
impervious to moisture to allow effective cleaning and sanitization thereby decreasing the risk of possible disease 
hazards.  Correct by May 24, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
